intro: Clinogyne flexuosa, commonly known as the wavy clinogyne, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, often wavy stems. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and can be aromatic, though the plant is not widely cultivated. Clinogyne flexuosa is typically found in damp, shaded areas such as forest floors and stream banks.
